title: A “QuitGPT” campaign is urging people to cancel their ChatGPT subscriptions

But he grew frustrated with the chatbot’s coding abilities and its gushing, meandering replies.

title: AI-generated ads dropped the ball at this year’s Super Bowl

title: AI Is Here to Replace Nuclear Treaties. Scared Yet?
summary: The last major nuclear arms treaty between the US and Russia just expired. Some experts believe a combination of satellite surveillance, AI, and human reviewers can take its place. Others, not so much.

title: Making AI Work, MIT Technology Review’s new AI newsletter, is here

title: Moltbook was peak AI theater
summary: For a few days this week the hottest new hangout on the internet was a vibe-coded Reddit clone called Moltbook, which billed itself as a social network for bots. As the website’s tagline puts it: “Where AI agents share, discuss, and upvote. Humans welcome to observe.

title: Consolidating systems for AI with iPaaS
summary: For decades, enterprises reacted to shifting business pressures with stopgap technology solutions. To rein in rising infrastructure costs, they adopted cloud services that could scale on demand. When customers shifted their lives onto smartphones, companies rolled out mobile apps to keep pace.
content: For decades, enterprises reacted to shifting business pressures with stopgap technology solutions. title: What AI can (and can’t) tell us about XRP in ETF-driven markets
summary: For a long time, cryptocurrency prices moved quickly. A headline would hit, sentiment would spike, and charts would react almost immediately. That pattern no longer holds. Todays market is slow, heavier than before, and shaped by forces that do not always announce themselves clearly.

title: Cryptocurrency markets a testbed for AI forecasting models
